intro: Thymus × czorsztynensis, commonly known as Czorsztyn thyme, is a hybrid species of thyme native to the Carpathian Mountains. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its aromatic, gray-green foliage and small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces tiny, oval-shaped fruits called achene, which are typical of the Lamiaceae family. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Due to its ornamental value and fragrance, it is often cultivated in gardens for both its beauty and culinary uses.
